html: The U.S. is 1 of 13 countries where the maternal mortality rate is higher than it was 25 years ago. For Black women, the risk of dying from pregnancy-related causes is 3-4x higher than for white women. My Maternal CARE Act would help reduce racial disparities in maternal health.
text:
The U.S. is 1 of 13 countries where the maternal mortality rate is higher than it was 25 years ago. For Black women, the risk of dying from pregnancy-related causes is 3-4x higher than for white women.

My Maternal CARE Act would help reduce racial disparities in maternal health.

html: Since the Mueller report was completed, Attorney General Barr has acted more like the president’s attorney than a protector of the rule of law. This isn't normal. Today my colleagues and I called on the DOJ Inspector General to investigate DOJ’s handling of the Mueller report.
text:
Since the Mueller report was completed, Attorney General Barr has acted more like the president’s attorney than a protector of the rule of law. This isn't normal.

Today my colleagues and I called on the DOJ Inspector General to investigate DOJ’s handling of the Mueller report.

html: We can't let the administration politicize the Census. They want to hurt states with large immigrant communities by intimidating these groups from participating. If the Supreme Court fails to fix this, Congress must ensure that every person – without exception – is counted.
text:
We can't let the administration politicize the Census. They want to hurt states with large immigrant communities by intimidating these groups from participating.

If the Supreme Court fails to fix this, Congress must ensure that every person – without exception – is counted.

html: More than 140 million Americans live in counties with dangerous air quality. We're talking about air pollution that contributes to asthma attacks, heart attacks and strokes. Enough. We must do everything we can to guarantee clean air to all Americans, period.
text:
More than 140 million Americans live in counties with dangerous air quality. We're talking about air pollution that contributes to asthma attacks, heart attacks and strokes.
 
Enough. We must do everything we can to guarantee clean air to all Americans, period.

html: Saddened to hear of the passing of Judge Damon J. Keith. A brilliant lawyer and civil rights icon, Judge Keith's rulings will have a lasting impact on American life for generations to come. My thoughts are with his three daughters and entire family during this difficult time.

html: What happened yesterday in Poway, CA was driven by hate. As leaders, we must confront this dark reality that lurks in the shadows of this nation we love. Grateful to the first responders who were on the scene. My heart is with the survivors and the victims’ loved ones.
text:
What happened yesterday in Poway, CA was driven by hate.

As leaders, we must confront this dark reality that lurks in the shadows of this nation we love. 

Grateful to the first responders who were on the scene. My heart is with the survivors and the victims’ loved ones.

html: Black women across all education & income levels are dying at higher rates from pregnancy and not enough is being done about it. My Maternal CARE Act would provide grants for implicit bias training and help reduce racial disparities in maternal health.

Black women across all education & income levels are dying at higher rates from pregnancy and not enough is being done about it.
 
My Maternal CARE Act would provide grants for implicit bias training and help reduce racial disparities in maternal health.

html: One of the ways we give back to workers who enter public service is by providing relief for some of their student loans. But under Secretary DeVos, this program is being stifled. My colleagues and I sent a letter to Secretary DeVos today demanding an end to this stonewalling.
text:
One of the ways we give back to workers who enter public service is by providing relief for some of their student loans. But under Secretary DeVos, this program is being stifled.

My colleagues and I sent a letter to Secretary DeVos today demanding an end to this stonewalling.

html: Today marks 104 years since the Armenian Genocide began. We cannot forget the 1.5 million Armenians killed between 1915 and 1923. I’m proud to co-sponsor a Senate resolution commemorating those lost and ensuring U.S. acknowledgement of this horrific chapter in history.
text:
Today marks 104 years since the Armenian Genocide began. We cannot forget the 1.5 million Armenians killed between 1915 and 1923.

I’m proud to co-sponsor a Senate resolution commemorating those lost and ensuring U.S. acknowledgement of this horrific chapter in history.

html: Republicans have all but eliminated time to debate judicial nominees. Today's vote on Patrick Wyrick shows why that's a problem: he's up for a *lifetime* appointment while facing allegations of unethical behavior. This should be disqualifying. I'm voting NO on his nomination.
text:
Republicans have all but eliminated time to debate judicial nominees. Today's vote on Patrick Wyrick shows why that's a problem: he's up for a *lifetime* appointment while facing allegations of unethical behavior.

This should be disqualifying. I'm voting NO on his nomination.

html: In 99% of counties in America, if you earn minimum wage and work full time, you can’t afford a 1-bedroom apartment at fair market rate. That's not right. I wrote the Rent Relief Act to give people with high housing costs more financial freedom each month.

In 99% of counties in America, if you earn minimum wage and work full time, you can’t afford a 1-bedroom apartment at fair market rate. That's not right.

html: Kirstjen Nielsen’s resignation was long overdue. As a member of the Senate Homeland Security Committee, let me be absolutely clear: I will under no circumstances support a nominee who does not forcefully denounce this administration’s policy of separating families at the border.
text:
Kirstjen Nielsen’s resignation was long overdue.

As a member of the Senate Homeland Security Committee, let me be absolutely clear: I will under no circumstances support a nominee who does not forcefully denounce this administration’s policy of separating families at the border.

html: Take a moment to appreciate the hard work that goes into putting food on the tables of American families. It’s unconscionable that farm workers often work 12+ hours a day without overtime pay. My bill, the Fairness for Farm Workers Act, would fix this.pic.twitter.com/bWJs4oMVzD
text:
Take a moment to appreciate the hard work that goes into putting food on the tables of American families.
 
It’s unconscionable that farm workers often work 12+ hours a day without overtime pay. My bill, the Fairness for Farm Workers Act, would fix this.pic.twitter.com/bWJs4oMVzD

html: Here's a truth: there's a student achievement gap in colleges and universities that persists across race & class and it threatens our students' ability to succeed. We need to fix it. Proud to join my colleagues on a bill to help these institutions do just that.

html: My mother was a scientist and I know the importance of ensuring more women enter & excel in this field. And that means we have to change the workplace climate in STEM & prevent sexual harassment. Today, @RepEBJ & I have introduced the Combating Sexual Harassment in Science Act.
text:
My mother was a scientist and I know the importance of ensuring more women enter & excel in this field. And that means we have to change the workplace climate in STEM & prevent sexual harassment.

Today, @RepEBJ & I have introduced the Combating Sexual Harassment in Science Act.

html: One day before his life was taken, Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. said these words: “Only when it is dark enough, can you see the stars.” I carry those words with me. We have to remember that no matter how dark these days may seem, there's so much energy, activism & optimism too.
text:
One day before his life was taken, Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. said these words: “Only when it is dark enough, can you see the stars.”

I carry those words with me. We have to remember that no matter how dark these days may seem, there's so much energy, activism & optimism too.

html: DREAMers are American in every way but on paper. They grew up here, serve in our military & contribute to our economy. And they should not be prevented from serving their country on Capitol Hill. Today I’m introducing legislation to lift the ban on DREAMers working for Congress.
text:
DREAMers are American in every way but on paper. They grew up here, serve in our military & contribute to our economy. And they should not be prevented from serving their country on Capitol Hill.

Today I’m introducing legislation to lift the ban on DREAMers working for Congress.

html: Everyone should pay attention to what is happening to our courts because this will impact us for generations to come. This Administration is committed to transforming our courts with extreme nominees who will bring bias to the bench. I’ll do everything I can to stop them.

html: Students should be able to go to college without going deep into a financial hole, and it's time we took action to make college debt-free. Proud to join my colleagues yesterday to introduce a bill that would help students go to college without going into debt.

html: The genius of the internet is that it levels the playing field for everyone, but in 2017 the FCC voted to take this away from the American people in favor of corporations that want to suppress competition. My colleagues & I introduced a bill today to restore #NetNeutrality.

html: As Acting Assistant AG, Readler filed the Trump administration’s brief in Texas v. U.S., which refused to defend the Affordable Care Act. This is a position that would eliminate protections for millions of Americans with preexisting conditions. That's why today I'm voting NO.
text:
As Acting Assistant AG, Readler filed the Trump administration’s brief in Texas v. U.S., which refused to defend the Affordable Care Act.
 
This is a position that would eliminate protections for millions of Americans with preexisting conditions.
 
That's why today I'm voting NO.

html: I asked CBP Commissioner McAleenan whether it's his duty to ensure immigrant children aren't sexually abused after they're transferred out of his agency. His response: I'm mandated by law to transfer these children, I don't have an ability to question that. This is outrageous.pic.twitter.com/SA2ugkEwyj
text:
I asked CBP Commissioner McAleenan whether it's his duty to ensure immigrant children aren't sexually abused after they're transferred out of his agency.
 
His response: I'm mandated by law to transfer these children, I don't have an ability to question that.

This is outrageous.pic.twitter.com/SA2ugkEwyj

html: The right to vote is fundamental, and we must expand access to the ballot so that our elections better reflect the will of the people. Proud to stand with my colleagues today to reintroduce the Voter Empowerment Act to protect voting rights and ensure equal access to the ballot.

html: Today I re-introduced the REUNITE Act, a bill that would: -ensure that immigrant families who can be safely reunited are immediately brought back together, -improve systems for family reunifications, -and provide humane alternatives to detention. It's just the right thing to do.
text:
Today I re-introduced the REUNITE Act, a bill that would:
-ensure that immigrant families who can be safely reunited are immediately brought back together,
-improve systems for family reunifications,
-and provide humane alternatives to detention. 
It's just the right thing to do.

html: I’m headed to the Senate floor right now to request my colleagues unanimously pass my anti-lynching bill. It’s absurd that Congress has tried and failed to do this dozens of times for the better part of a century. Let’s get it done.pic.twitter.com/HBOLxuhTTv
text: I’m headed to the Senate floor right now to request my colleagues unanimously pass my anti-lynching bill. It’s absurd that Congress has tried and failed to do this dozens of times for the better part of a century. Let’s get it done.pic.twitter.com/HBOLxuhTTv

html: Lynching is a murder. It’s torture. But after a century of trying, it’s still not a federal crime. It’s time to fix that - that's why this morning @SenBooker and I are going to ask our Senate colleagues to unanimously approve my anti-lynching bill.
text: Lynching is a murder. It’s torture. But after a century of trying, it’s still not a federal crime. It’s time to fix that - that's why this morning @SenBooker and I are going to ask our Senate colleagues to unanimously approve my anti-lynching bill.

html: It's been one year since these 17 lives were tragically lost at Stoneman Douglas High School & one year since brave survivors of this day began challenging us to rise up & say never again. We must listen to them. Today, I'm recommitting myself to fighting for gun safety reform.
text: It's been one year since these 17 lives were tragically lost at Stoneman Douglas High School & one year since brave survivors of this day began challenging us to rise up & say never again. We must listen to them. Today, I'm recommitting myself to fighting for gun safety reform.

text:
Heavy #LArain could bring flooding & mud/debris flows to #WoolseyFire burn area today. Does your property have limited access?
- Remain vigilant
- Identify multiple exit routes & park your vehicle facing your primary route 
- If you become trapped, seek high ground & call 9-1-1

html: It's absurd that so Americans today are struggling to keep up with the rising cost of living. One thing we can do to address this is expand Social Security so that seniors & other beneficiaries can live with greater peace of mind. I've co-sponsored a bill today to do just that.

html: As a @HowardU student I was proud to walk the same halls as some of my heroes like Thurgood Marshall & I want to ensure others have that chance too. Grateful that the Senate passed my bill yesterday to reauthorize a program that would protect historic buildings & sites at HBCUs.

html: Gun violence is a national epidemic & we must take action to protect Americans & prevent more heartbreaking tragedies. I'm proud that this week my colleagues & I took a critical step by introducing a bill to ban high-capacity magazines that are designed to make guns more deadly.

html: NEWS: The Senate has just passed my bill to reauthorize a program to protect & preserve historic HBCU buildings and sites across the country. I'm thrilled we were able to advance this & hopeful we can get it signed into law so that HBCUs can get the vital improvements they need.
text: NEWS: The Senate has just passed my bill to reauthorize a program to protect & preserve historic HBCU buildings and sites across the country. I'm thrilled we were able to advance this & hopeful we can get it signed into law so that HBCUs can get the vital improvements they need.

html: Today, the Senate is voting to advance the nomination of William Barr to be the next Attorney General. It's clear Barr won’t defend independent investigations from attacks or ensure equal protection under law for all Americans. I will vote NO & urge my colleagues to do the same.
text: Today, the Senate is voting to advance the nomination of William Barr to be the next Attorney General. It's clear Barr won’t defend independent investigations from attacks or ensure equal protection under law for all Americans. I will vote NO & urge my colleagues to do the same.

html: “The pain of losing a child to gun violence never ends. We must listen to her.pic.twitter.com/e4k8oJJyGT
text:
“The pain of losing a child to gun violence never ends. And it’s that pain that drives me to do this work to prevent gun violence.”
 
@RepLucyMcBath lost her son to gun violence in 2012 and is now in Congress advocating for common sense gun safety policies. We must listen to her.pic.twitter.com/e4k8oJJyGT

html: Many farm workers often work over 12 hours a day in the hot sun. It's outrageous they don't receive overtime pay for the work they do. I've re-introduced a bill today to grant farm workers overtime protections & eliminate most minimum wage exemptions they face.

html: I am voting YES on a clean bill to end this shutdown and put 800,000 federal employees back to work. Republicans unanimously supported this plan in December—but now they’re playing politics with people’s lives. Enough. Let’s re-open the government today.
text:
I am voting YES on a clean bill to end this shutdown and put 800,000 federal employees back to work. Republicans unanimously supported this plan in December—but now they’re playing politics with people’s lives.

Enough. Let’s re-open the government today.

html: It's been 34 days since the government shut down. The Senate will vote on a clean bill today to fund the government that we unanimously approved one month ago. Let’s get this done. 800,000 federal workers are counting on us.

53,000 TSA workers

html: Despite these concerns, overall, this measure takes positive steps to improve our justice system, and I intend to vote for it.
text: Despite these concerns, overall, this measure takes positive steps to improve our justice system, and I intend to vote for it.

html: It should also further expand application of earned good time credits, place more prohibitions on private prisons which profit from the incarceration of individuals, and further limit the use of electronic monitoring.
text: It should also further expand application of earned good time credits, place more prohibitions on private prisons which profit from the incarceration of individuals, and further limit the use of electronic monitoring.

html: To start: all of the bill’s sentencing reforms should be applied retroactively.
text: To start: all of the bill’s sentencing reforms should be applied retroactively.

html: But, to be clear, the FIRST STEP Act is very much just that – a first step. It is a compromise of a compromise, and we ultimately need to make far greater reforms if we are to right the wrongs that exist in our criminal justice system.
text: But, to be clear, the FIRST STEP Act is very much just that – a first step. It is a compromise of a compromise, and we ultimately need to make far greater reforms if we are to right the wrongs that exist in our criminal justice system.

html: It also enables the use of good time credits, provides greater access to education and substance abuse treatment. It eliminates the shackling of pregnant prisoners, requires healthcare products for incarcerated women, and ends federal juvenile solitary confinement.
text: It also enables the use of good time credits, provides greater access to education and substance abuse treatment. It eliminates the shackling of pregnant prisoners, requires healthcare products for incarcerated women, and ends federal juvenile solitary confinement.

html: It allows judges greater discretion to reduce unfair sentences for low-level, nonviolent drug offenders and eliminate unjust sentencing enhancement.
text: It allows judges greater discretion to reduce unfair sentences for low-level, nonviolent drug offenders and eliminate unjust sentencing enhancement.

html: This bill reforms some of the most draconian federal sentencing laws, including unfair mandatory minimum sentences under two- and three-strikes laws, and retroactively applying the reduced sentencing disparity between crack and powder cocaine.
text: This bill reforms some of the most draconian federal sentencing laws, including unfair mandatory minimum sentences under two- and three-strikes laws, and retroactively applying the reduced sentencing disparity between crack and powder cocaine.

html: For too long sentencing has been overly severe & disproportionately targeted communities of color – especially Black men.
text: For too long sentencing has been overly severe & disproportionately targeted communities of color – especially Black men.

html: Americans deserve a criminal justice system that is both fair and smart. By passing the FIRST STEP Act, we can start to make our criminal justice system smarter.
text: Americans deserve a criminal justice system that is both fair and smart. By passing the FIRST STEP Act, we can start to make our criminal justice system smarter.

html: I wanted to share my thoughts with you all in a quick thread on the FIRST STEP Act, a criminal justice reform bill that the Senate will begin voting on tonight.

html: 33-year-old Roxana Hernández entered CBP & ICE custody on May 9 & died in custody 16 days later. Today I'm sending a letter demanding these agencies immediately release a report on her death & information on how agents are trained to treat & safeguard transgender individuals.

html: Economic justice is worth fighting for. Too many families are one $500 expense away from financial catastrophe. We need to pass the LIFT Act and the Rent Relief Act to put more money back in families’ pockets and help them keep up with the cost of living.
text: Economic justice is worth fighting for. Too many families are one $500 expense away from financial catastrophe. We need to pass the LIFT Act and the Rent Relief Act to put more money back in families’ pockets and help them keep up with the cost of living.

html: The rule of law is worth fighting for. In the Senate, we need the ability to advise and consent on lifetime appointments to the courts and to make sure these nominees reflect the best interests of our country.
text: The rule of law is worth fighting for. In the Senate, we need the ability to advise and consent on lifetime appointments to the courts and to make sure these nominees reflect the best interests of our country.

html: Election security is worth fighting for. We need to devote more resources to upgrading states’ election systems and replacing antiquated voting machines.
text: Election security is worth fighting for. We need to devote more resources to upgrading states’ election systems and replacing antiquated voting machines.

html: Criminal justice reform is worth fighting for. We need to rethink sentencing guidelines and replace the cash bail system.
text: Criminal justice reform is worth fighting for. We need to rethink sentencing guidelines and replace the cash bail system.

html: Voting rights are worth fighting for. We need to restore the full protections of the Voting Rights Act so that no eligible voter is ever denied the right to vote.

html: In 2017, Latina women were paid on average 53 cents for every dollar paid to white males. Today, on Latina Equal Pay Day, it’s time to speak truth about the wage gap, call on employers to take steps to address it, and redouble our efforts to pass legislation to ensure fair pay.

html: The LIFT the Middle Class Act would positively impact an estimated one in every two workers and one in every three children in America. The rich and powerful are doing just fine. We need to do something for the middle class.

html: It is absolutely unconscionable that while many families continue to struggle, President Trump and Republicans in Congress are giving tax cuts to the top 1% and corporations while threatening Social Security and Medicare. It’s time to change that.

html: Everywhere I go, people tell me that one unexpected expense could throw their family into financial turmoil. Americans are working harder than ever, but wages are staying flat. Let’s put some money back in their pockets.

html: “I don't mind a good fight. For reasons known only to God, I've had quite a few tough ones in my life. But I learned an important lesson along the way: In the end, it matters less that you can fight. What you fight for is the real test.” – Senator John McCain

html: 51 years ago, today, the Senate confirmed Thurgood Marshall to the Supreme Court, where he continued his work of making this country a more equal one. It matters who sits on the Supreme Court. #StopKavanaugh

html: When black mothers try to receive care, their symptoms and pains are ignored by our health care system too often. That’s one reason why black women in the U.S. are 3 to 4 times more likely to die from pregnancy-related causes than white women. #BlackMaternalMortalitypic.twitter.com/RhCDPtG0fU

When black mothers try to receive care, their symptoms and pains are ignored by our health care system too often.

html: On this day 63 years ago, Emmett Till was abducted by two white men and brutally murdered. To this day lynching is still not a federal crime. I’ve introduced the Justice for Victims of Lynching Act to make it one.

html: Hurricane Maria caused an estimated 2,975 deaths, not 64 like the government claims. This Administration needs to be held accountable for its failures & Congress must pass the COUNT Act to establish procedures for getting an accurate death toll after a natural disaster.
text: Hurricane Maria caused an estimated 2,975 deaths, not 64 like the government claims. This Administration needs to be held accountable for its failures & Congress must pass the COUNT Act to establish procedures for getting an accurate death toll after a natural disaster.

html: New #Maria death toll numbers are a tragic reminder of how our nation failed Puerto Rico. We must ensure an accurate death count for future disasters. That’s why I’ve joined @SenKamalaHarris to introduce the COUNT Act, a bill to develop federal standards for counting fatalities.
text: New #Maria death toll numbers are a tragic reminder of how our nation failed Puerto Rico. We must ensure an accurate death count for future disasters. That’s why I’ve joined @SenKamalaHarris to introduce the COUNT Act, a bill to develop federal standards for counting fatalities.

html: When we talk about how dangerous arming teachers is, we also must talk about what it means for Black & Latino students specifically. There’s overwhelming evidence that shows harsh disciplinary protocols in our schools disproportionately impact children of color.
text: When we talk about how dangerous arming teachers is, we also must talk about what it means for Black & Latino students specifically. There’s overwhelming evidence that shows harsh disciplinary protocols in our schools disproportionately impact children of color.

html: Here are a few *good* ideas on how to make our schools safer: Make background checks universal & ensure data is getting into the system Ban military-style assault weapons Ban bump stocks Ban high capacity magazines Raise the minimum age to purchase rifles
text:
Here are a few *good* ideas on how to make our schools safer:
 
Make background checks universal & ensure data is getting into the system
Ban military-style assault weapons
Ban bump stocks
Ban high capacity magazines
Raise the minimum age to purchase rifles

html: Home health care workers – 90 percent of whom are women – are one of the fastest growing and lowest paid jobs. The Trump Administration has proposed a new rule to restrict their right to join together in a union. I am demanding that this proposed rule be abandoned.

html: Republicans just announced that they are scheduling a hearing for Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh starting on September 4. This is outrageous. No one will be able to look at his full record before the hearing – not me, not you, not anyone. It won’t have been made public.

html: Frankly, every single one of the 100 senators should want to see Kavanaugh’s full record. It’s not just about our duty to vet the nominee, it’s also about transparency for the American people.pic.twitter.com/4KtHwTY70N
